intro: Tetraria bromoides, commonly known as the common tetraria, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. Tetraria bromoides is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
